I'm late browsing through the messages, but I just wanted to say -- it's
really neat to see people talk about Gladiator ... lots of things you folks
have come up with (both problems, and neat things to do) go beyond what we
even thought of at the time we coded the game.  Somehow I suspect that if
any of us four original coders tried to compete against y'all, we'd get our
butts kicked :)
 
And thanks for the kudos on W3! Things have sure been busy around here the
last month or so because of it ... have any of you tried the special
single-player map that lets four players go through in a Diablo-style map?
It's a pretty neat warping of the game :)
 
Also, I just wanted to give another "good work!" message to Zardus and
aglswapbuffers, who are getting the original Glad code to run on a modern
operating system, natively in a window, and all that neat stuff -- it's
really cool to watch it progress!
 
--Tom

-----Original Message-----
From: bluedrgnkid@... [mailto:bluedrgnkid@...]
Sent: Thursday, July 11, 2002 1:13 PM
To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [gladiator] Re: 7-7-2002


I always trained 2 characters that complemented each other, such as a Druid 
and a Mage, a Thief and a Fighter, and the one I love to do, Thief and 
Archmage. The Archmage can conjure 4+ fire elementals, while the thief
charms 
people.                       

And if Tom reads this, good job releasing WCIII ( I think he's at 
blizzard..... )
